title: @Riot, a quick question about possible future voice over updates.
body:
If you were to update someone's voice like Shen, who already got a VGU minus a new VO, would you bring in the original VA (in this case Keith Silverstein) to do their voice again or would you try to bring in a different voice actor to change the direction of how they sound?

Just something I was thinking about, since we've only seen one of these recently and I was wondering what you guys (and gals) think about this.

replies.body:
We "like" to use the original actors when we can, but it's a complete variable with reworks:   
1. Can the actor still do the voice?  (voices age and can be damaged)
2.  Is the actor available in our timeframe?   (Conflicting show, out of country  etc..)
3. Is the character's VO direction or backstory changing signifcantly?
4.  How does the rework pod, VO team, and narrative team feel about the original performance?.  
5. If there has been a small shift in the character--- is the original actor able to perform that?
etc...

Dang it, Bobbeh...

Riot's voice over jobs are not compliant with the Screen Actors Guild - American Federation of Television and Radio Artists (SAG-AFTRA).

Basically, a "Union job" requires the company to pay a "Session Fee" for the time spent in a booth working on the performance as well as a "Use Fee" for every instance of that session is used. (This is also known as "royalties.")  Just imagine how much Riot would have to pay Carrie Keranen in royalties for her performance as Lux and you might understand why Riot's jobs are non-Union.

So, in theory, Riot Games will negotiate a one-time session fee for a Voice Actor that might pay _more_ than a similar Union job, but would give up any future claims on royalties.  Anime VOs are another form of "non-union" job, which explains why there's a lot of crossover between anime and video games.

Now, there are some unionized voice actors that do non-union work, provided that their name is kept secret.  (A big rumor is that Yorick's VA is one of these union actors.)

Still, if Shen's VA has joined the union since he last worked with Riot, he might not be able to return for another performance.

I hope that makes sense.

They never mentioned their system reflecting the Union system, so I suppose the VAs are contracted to a specific set of rules. After all, they do get paid quite well and so far no VAs have had an issue with it.

And the only VAs that have had an issue with Riot's methods are the ones that declined to work with them. :)
